title: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Functional Gallbladder Disorder
desc: The Rome IV Criteria for Functional Gallbladder Disorder provides criteria for diagnosis of functional gallbladder disorder.

orgreference.text: Cotton PB, Elta GH, Carter CR, Pasricha PJ, Corazziari ES. Rome IV. Gallbladder and Sphincter of Oddi Disorders. Gastroenterology. 2016;150:1420-1429.

data.evidence:
To fulfill the Rome IV criteria for functional gallbladder disorder,* patient must have the following: 

  1. Biliary pain.
  2. Absence of gallstones or other structural pathology. 

*Supportive Criteria:

  • Low ejection fraction on gallbladder scintigraphy.
  • Normal liver enzymes, conjugated bilirubin, and amylase/lipase.
